新型コロナウイルス感染症が心配なときに: How to get help if you suspect you have COVID-19
詳細を見る（東京都福祉保健局）: Details:See the website (of Tokyo Metropolitan Government Bureau of Social Welfare and Public Health)
相談方法は、症状や状況別で3つに分かれます: Which of the following is your situation?
かかりつけ医がいて症状のある方: You are experiencing symptoms and have a primary care doctor
かかりつけ医がいない症状のある方: You are experiencing symptoms and do not have a primary care doctor
かかりつけ医がいない、次の症状がある方: If you do not have a primary care doctor and have the following:
かかりつけ医がいて、次の症状がある方: If you have a primary care doctor and have the following:
日ごろ受診されている医療機関に電話でご相談ください。: Call to consult your doctor or medical institution.
新型コロナ受診相談窓口は、24時間対応しています: The COVID-19 Consultation Hotline is available 24 hours.
{publicHealthCenter}に掲載しています: Please See this page for details {publicHealthCenter}
各保健所の電話番号は福祉保健局HP: Detail: Check each call-number of Public Health Center on the website (by Tokyo Bureau of Social Welfare and Public Health)
上記の症状に当てはまらない方は、新型コロナコールセンターにご相談ください。: If you do not have these symptoms, contact the Tokyo COVID-19 Call Center.
医師が検査の必要性を判断いたします。: A doctor will determine the need for a test.
マスクをして公共交通機関をできるだけ使わずに受診をしてください。: Wear a mask and avoid public transportation if possible.
医師により検査が必要だと判断されPCR検査（東京都健康安全研究センター等）を受け: After a doctor determines that a test is needed, you receive a PCR test at the Tokyo Metropolitan Institute of Public Health or elsewhere, and you:
感染症指定医療機関等への入院、又は宿泊施設等での療養となります: You will be admitted to a designated medical institution or lodging facility to receive treatment.
ただし、症状が良くならない場合は再度受診相談窓口またはかかりつけ医に相談してくだ: If your symptoms do not improve, consult your doctor or the Tokyo COVID-19 Consultation Hotline.
自分や家族の症状に不安や心配があればまずは電話相談をどうぞ: Please call us first If you have any concerns about symptom in you or your family.

不特定多数の人の集まる場所等への外出を避け、基本的に自宅で過ごしてください。: Please stay at home,and avoid going out to crowded places.
手洗い、咳エチケット等により、感染予防に努めてください。: Please make sure that everyone in your family washes their hands regularly and practices cough etiquette.

規則正しい生活を心がけ、日常の健康管理に十分気を付けてください。: Please be careful about your health care everyday.

当サイトは新型コロナウイルス感染症 (COVID-19) に関する最新情報を提供: This website was opened by the Tokyo Metropolitan Government to provide the latest information of COVID-19.
東京都による公式情報と客観的な数値をわかりやすく伝えることで、東京都にお住まいの: By conveying official information of the Tokyo Metropolitan Government and objective data in an easy-to-understand way, this site aims to allow Tokyo residents, companies with offices in Tokyo, and visitors to Tokyo to grasp the current situation and take measures and precautions accordingly.
当サイトは以下の環境でご覧いただくことを推奨いたします。: This site is recommended to view in following browsers

クッキーとは、Webコンテンツからの要求で利用者の手元の端末に一時的に保存される: A cookie is data sent from a website and temporarily stored on the user's computer. Here, cookies may be used to track website activity.
ブラウザに関する情報の収集を希望しない場合は、インターネット閲覧ソフト（ブラウザ: If you do not wish your browsing data to be collected, you can disable cookies from your web browser.
ただし、クッキーを受け入れない設定をされている場合は、当サイトの機能が正常に動作: However, If you do not accept cookies, the functions of this site might not work.
Google Analyticsの利用について: About the using of Google Analytics
当サイトでは、サービス向上やサイトの改善のためにGoogle LLCの提供するア: This site uses Google Analytics, an analytics service provided by Google LLC, to track website activity for site improvement and provision of better services.
Google Analyticsでは、当サイトが発行するクッキー (Cookie: Google Analytics uses Cookies to collect anonymous usage data(page views, traffic, used OS/browser information and so on). We use {Cookies based on Google's privacy policy and terms.
取得したデータはWebサイト利用状況を分析しサービスの改善につなげるため、または: The collected data will be used only to analyze website usage and services improvement, or to create reports for publishers, and only to provide other services. (In the report to publishers, cookies count the number of users of this site on a browser-by-browser basis. Google Analytics uses the IP address analysis function to determine the geographical distribution of the access source (country, state / prefecture, city)

Google Analyticsによる情報送信を回避する場合は、Google が: If you want to avoid sending information by Google Analytics, please use {addon} supported by Google.
当サイトに掲載されている情報の正確性については万全を期していますが、東京都は利用: Although every effort has been made to ensure the accuracy of the information posted on this site, The Tokyo Metropolitan Government will not be responsible for any actions taken by users using the information on this site.
また、利用者が当サイトを利用したことにより発生した利用者の損害及び利用者が第三者: The Tokyo Metropolitan Government will not be responsible for any damage that may occur to a user or damage that the user may cause to a third party, as a result of using this website.

休業要請緩和のステップについては、令和2年5月22日時点の状況を「ステップ0」と: We explained that there are 4 steps to alleviate leave requests for facilities. “Step 0”, which referred to the situation as of 22nd May 2020. After that, it gradually proceeded to "Step 3" based on the characteristics of the facilities and the history of cluster occurrence. Now, Almost all facilities stopped unsealing from June 11 (Thursday).
なお、接待を伴う飲食店等及びライブハウスについては、6月18日（木）をもって、休: In addition, Restaurants with entertainment, and "Gig Venues" will stop unsealing from June 18 (Thursday).

※イベントの開催に当たっては、引き続き規模に応じた制限があります。: *All events will continue to be limited according to scale.
休業要請緩和のステップについては、令和2年5月22日時点の状況を「ステップ0」と: We explained that there are 4 steps to alleviate leave requests for facilities. “Step 0”, which referred to the situation as of 22nd May 2020. After that, it gradually proceeded to "Step 3" based on the characteristics of the facilities and the history of cluster occurrence. Now, All facilities stopped unsealing Thursday, 18th June.

上記の考え方で重症患者数の計上を開始した4月27日から作成: Seriously ill patients were determined by the above criteria starting April 27th.
当サイトにおいて入院患者数の公表を開始した3月6日から作成: The graph starts on March 6th, from when the number of hospitalized patients was first published on this website.
入院患者数のうち、集中治療室（ICU）等での管理又は人工呼吸器管理が必要な患者数: Within hospitalized patients, "serious symptoms" are considered to be those patients in the ICU or in need of ventilators.
保健所から発生届が提出された日を基準とする: From the date when the Public Health Center provided the information.
チャーター機帰国者、クルーズ船乗客等は含まれていない: Excluding returnees on charter flights or cruise ship passengers
5月11日までの入院患者数には宿泊療養者・自宅療養者等を含んでいるため、参考値で: The number of inpatients up to May 11th includes accommodation and home care patients, so it is a reference value.
集団感染発生や曜日による数値のばらつきにより、日々の結果が変動するため、こうした: The positive rate here is a 7-day moving average that evens out the day-to-day variation caused by mass infections and other factors, for the purpose of overall trend analysis with line graph (e.g. the positive rate of May 7th is calculated by the average during the 1st to 7th of May.)
本グラフは、新たなモニタリング項目から除外されたこと、日々公開している陽性者数か: This graph will be deleted as of July 17, as it has been excluded from the new index of monitorings.
速報値として公開するものであり、後日確定データとして修正される場合がある: The number is published as a preliminary figure and may be revised as confirmed data at a later date
5月13日以降は、PCR検査に加え、抗原検査の件数を含む: Starting May 13th, this includes both PCR tests and antigen tests.
検体採取日を基準とする。ただし、一部検査結果判明日に基づくものを含む: Based on the date of sample collection, except for some cases based on the date when the test result is confirmed
同一の対象者について複数の検体を検査する場合がある: More than one sample from the same subject may be tested.
患者発生の動向をより正確に分析するため、各保健所から報告があった患者の発生情報を: In order to more accurately analyze the trend of the outbreak, the occurrence of infected people confirmed by their doctor was reported from each health center by PCR test each day (per confirmed date)
新型コロナ受診相談窓口 （帰国者・接触者電話相談センター）を開設した2月7日から: The graph starts from Feb 7th, when the Tokyo COVID-19 Consultation Hotline (for Returnees and Potential Contact Persons) was opened.
曜日などによる数値のばらつきにより、日々の結果が変動するため、こうしたばらつきを: The moving averages for the past 7 days are shown as a line graph for the purpose of leveling these variations and looking at the overall trend. (ex. the May 7th moving average for the day is the average of the actual values from 1st May to 7th May.) The moving average is used because daily results fluctuate due to variations in the number of cases depending on the day of the week, etc.
保健所から発生届が提出された日別（報告日別）の新規陽性者について、接触歴等の不明: New positives for each day (on the reported date) submitted by the public health center were classified into unknown or known infection routes.
増加比は、１週間前の接触歴等不明者数（移動平均値）との比較: "Rate of Increase" is a comparison with the moving average from one week ago of positive tests with an unknown route of infection
新規陽性者における接触歴等不明者数: Number of positive test results with an unknown route of infection
濃厚接触者など、患者の発生状況の内訳の公表を開始した3月27日から作成: The graph starts from March 27, from which the breakdown of patients (such as infections from close contacts) is published
集団感染発生や曜日による数値のばらつきにより、日々の結果が変動するため、こうした: The positive rate here is a 7-day moving average that evens out the day-to-day variation caused by mass infections and other factors, for the purpose of overall trend analysis. (e.g. the positive rate of 7th May is calculated by the average during 1st to 7th May.)
接触歴等不明者数（７日間移動平均）: Number of test positives with an unknown route of infection (7-day moving average)
5月13日から6月16日までに行われた抗原検査については、結果が陰性の場合、PC: About the antigen test performed from 13 May to 16 June: If the result was negative, a confirmatory test by PCR was required. So, Duplication of the number of tests had been excluded and only the number of positive results was recorded. But, Now the antigen tests have performed after 17 June, both the number of positive findings and the number of negative findings are counted.
陽性率：陽性判明数（PCR・抗原）の移動平均／検査人数（＝陽性判明数（PCR・抗: Rate of Test Positives: moving average of confirmed positive test results (PCR * antigen)/moving average of all (positive and negative) tested people
集団感染発生や曜日による数値のばらつきにより、日々の結果が変動するため、こうした: The positive rate here is a 7-day moving average that evens out the day-to-day variation caused by mass infections and other factors, for the purpose of overall trend analysis. (e.g. the positive rate of 7th May is calculated by the average during 1st to 7th May.)
検査人数（７日間移動平均）: Number of tested people(a 7-days moving average)
集団感染発生や曜日による数値のばらつきにより、日々の結果が変動するため、こうした: The positive rate here is a 7-day moving average that evens out the day-to-day variation caused by mass infections and other factors, for the purpose of overall trend analysis with line graph (e.g. the positive rate of July 7th is calculated by the average during 1st to 7th of July.)

最新のモニタリング項目の分析・総括コメントについて: About trends of the latest monitorings

体制強化が必要であると思われる: It seems that the medical system needs to be strengthened.
毎週、専門家による状況分析を項目ごとに行い、都内の感染状況と医療提供体制それぞれ: Every week, Analysts will evaluate in 4 levels as "Trends " about the infection and each medical system provisions in Tokyo.
感染が拡大していると思われる: It seems that the infection in Tokyo is spreading.
東京都では、都内の「感染状況」と「医療提供体制」を2つの柱として7つのモニタリン: In the Tokyo Metropolitan Government, there are 7 items being monitored, based on the two core pillars of ”Infection Trends in Tokyo" and ”Medical System Provisions”.
感染状況・医療提供体制の分析: Analysis of ”The Infection trends in Tokyo" and ”Medical System Provisions”.
入院患者数のうち、人工呼吸器管理（ECMOを含む）が必要な患者数を計上: Within hospitalized patients, "serious symptoms" are considered to be those patients who need ventilators or ECMO.
届出保健所別の内訳: Cases by public health center location
退院者数の把握には一定の期間を要しており、確認次第数値を更新している: It takes a certain period of time to confirm hospital discharges, and the number will be updated as information becomes available
「重症」は、人工呼吸器管理（ECMOを含む）が必要な患者数を計上: "Serious symptoms" is the number of patients who need ventilators or ECMO

{number}：急病やけがの際に、緊急受診の必要性や診察可能な医療機関をアドバ: {number}: telephone consultation service to advise on the necessity of emergency care and available medical institutions in case of sudden illness or injury
事業者における家賃等の負担を軽減し、事業の継続を下支えするため、国の家賃支援給付: Tokyo Metropolitan Government pays extra benefit (for 3 months) on National Rent Support Benefit to reduce a burden of house-rent or the like for businesses and uphold the business continuation.
「重症」は、人工呼吸器管理（ECMOを含む）が必要な患者数を計上。: "Serious symptoms" is the number of patients who need ventilators or ECMO.
入院患者数のうち、人工呼吸器管理（ECMOを含む）が必要な患者数を計上。: Within hospitalized patients, "serious symptoms" are considered to be those patients who need ventilators or ECMO.
新型コロナウイルス感染拡大防止のため、酒類の提供を行う飲食店及びカラオケ店に対す: Tokyo will provide aid by fund to small and medium-sized businesses with restaurants and karaoke stores that provide alcoholic that fully cooperate requests to shorten business hours to prevent the spread of COVID-19.
営業時間短縮に係る感染拡大防止協力金: Infection Spread Prevention Support Fund for shorten the amount of business hour
